page.title: 20GEORDIE / MURTONIAN DIALECT.
page.content:
Our English lauguage has many varied dialects.The spoken dialect in our area is known as"{geordie}"a rich and expresive lauguage in its own right.
The word geordie was used during the reign of George 111 as a term of abuse meaning the person was idiotic like George 111 during his fits of madness.The pitmen adopted the name and used it amoug themselves in a friendly fashon.By 1860 it was an accepted name for anyone who lived in the North East. {A few geordie words _ pet or hinnie _ terms of endearment. netty _ toilet. Hods _ lots . Pyet _ face. Me marra _ myfriend. Howay _ come on. Ganzy _ jumper. Gan on _ come on. Wey aye man _ but of course.
